curam.util.type
Class DateTime

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.type.DateTime
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<DateTime>
public class DateTime
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<DateTime>

Represents a Curam DateTime as a Java millisecond value. The value is truncated to the nearest second.

DateTime instances are immutable so their values can be safely shared among multiple referents.

DateTime provides convenience methods to compare DateTimes, to get the current system date/time. For other computation involving dates use the java.util.Calendar class. DateTime can be converted to an instance of this class using its getCalendar method.

See Also:
Date, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

DateTime

public DateTime(long time)
Construct a DateTime from a millisecond time value. The date time is set to that represented by the specified millisecond time value in the default timezone.

Parameters:
time - millisecond time value

DateTime

public DateTime(DateTime dateTime)
Construct a Date from a DateTime. The date/time is set equal to the specified date/time.

Parameters:
dateTime - DateTime value to be set

DateTime

public DateTime(java.util.Calendar calendar)
Construct a DateTime from a calendar. The DateTime is set equal to the calendar date represented by the Calendar object in the default timezone . This is the equivalent of calling Date(cal.getTime()).

Parameters:
calendar - The calendar containing the required date.
Method Detail

fromISO8601

public static DateTime fromISO8601(java.lang.String isoString)
                            throws DateConversionException
Get a DateTime from an ISO 8601 string in the format yyyymmddThhmmss. The string must be exactly 15 characters long with a 'T' as the ninth character. the subfields are parsed as integers and then formatted as a date using java.util.GregorianCalendar. This means that field wrapping can occur according to the rules used by GregorianCalendar, for instance a seconds value of 61 would cause the minute value to wrap.

Parameters:
isoString - the ISO 8601 format string.
Returns:
a new DateTime object
Throws:
DateConversionException - If the string is null, is not the correct length or does not match the expected format.

minutes - Number of minutes to add (may be negative).
seconds - Number of seconds to add (may be negative).

new Date result

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Convert this DateTime to a string using the format defined by the properties curam.environment.default.dateformat and curam.environment.default.dateseparator. These properties should be specified in the Bootstrap.properties file. If these properties are not specified, the date is returned as a string with the default yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss format. The curam.environment.default.locale property is used to determine the locale that will be used when formatting the string.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
The dateTime as a formatted string.

toString

public java.lang.String toString(java.lang.String locale)
Convert this DateTime to a string using the format defined by the properties curam.environment.default.dateformat and curam.environment.default.dateseparator. These properties should be specified in the Bootstrap.properties file. If these properties are not specified, the date is returned as a string with the default yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss format. The string will be formatted based on the locale passed in.

Parameters:
locale - The locale used to format the dateTime as a String.
Returns:
The dateTime as a formatted string.

toString

public java.lang.String toString(java.util.Locale locale)
Convert this DateTime to a string using the format defined by the properties curam.environment.default.dateformat and curam.environment.default.dateseparator. These properties should be specified in the Bootstrap.properties file. If these properties are not specified, the date is returned as a string with the default yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss format. The string will be formatted based on the locale passed in.

Parameters:
locale - The locale used to format the dateTime as a String.
Returns:
The dateTime as a formatted string.

getDateTime

public static DateTime getDateTime(java.lang.String isoDate)
                            throws DateConversionException
Factory method that returns new DateTime object.

Parameters:
isoDate - ISO formatted date. This string must be in the format.
  • HHMMSS
  • YYYYMMDDTHHMMSS
  • YYYMMDDTHHMMSS
  • YYYYMMDD
  • YYYMMDD
For the first of these the new DateTime will have a date element representing the current date.
Returns:
new DateTime object
Throws:
DateConversionException - The string does not match the any of the expected formats, or the fields are invalid (e.g 31st of September).

getCurrentDateTime

public static DateTime getCurrentDateTime()
Get the current DateTime which can be one of the following, in the following order of precedence:
  • The business DateTime for the current transaction if specified.
  • Midnight of the beginning of the date specified by application property curam.test.date.override, if set.
  • The system DateTime.

    Returns:
    The current or overridden DateTime.

    • overrideCurrentDate

    public static void overrideCurrentDate(Date date)
    Override current date.

    Parameters:
    date - to be returned by getCurrentDateTime() (hours, minutes and seconds will be zero i.e. midnight).

    overrideDateTime

    public static void overrideDateTime(java.lang.String overrideDateTimeStr)
                             throws java.lang.RuntimeException
    Override current DateTime.

    Parameters:
    overrideDateTimeStr - The overridden DateTime in YYYYMMDDhhmmss format.
    Throws:
    java.lang.RuntimeException - if a NumberFormatException occurs while parsing the overrideDateTimeStr parameter

    undoOverrideDateTime

    public static void undoOverrideDateTime()
    Undo the overriding of the date time and allow the system date time to be used again.
